content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is an example of how you can create a function to add the year and month columns to a DataFrame:
```julia
using Dates, DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[!, :ym] = [Dates.format(dt, "yyyymm") for dt in df[:, :dt]]
end
```
This function uses the `Dates` module to format the dates as "yyyymm" strings and adds them to a new column `:ym`. The function also uses the `DataFrames` module to add this column to the DataFrame.

You can call this function with your DataFrame like this:
```julia
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will add a new column `:ym` containing the year and month in format "yyyymm".
